Cancer: I would cure cancer first because it is a deadly disease that affects millions of people worldwide. Cancer can be caused by various factors, including genetics, lifestyle choices, and environmental factors. By curing cancer, we can save countless lives and improve the quality of life for those who have been diagnosed with the disease.

Mental Health Disorders: I would cure mental health disorders such as depression, anxiety, and bipolar disorder. These disorders can be debilitating and can affect a person's daily life. By curing mental health disorders, we can help people live happier and more fulfilling lives.

Infectious Diseases: I would cure infectious diseases such as HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, and malaria. These diseases are spread easily and can have devastating effects on individuals and communities. By curing infectious diseases, we can prevent the spread of these diseases and improve the health of those who have been infected.

Aging: I would cure aging. Aging is a natural process, but it can lead to various health problems such as dementia, heart disease, and cancer. By curing aging, we can improve the quality of life for older adults and prevent age-related diseases.

Environmental Pollution: I would cure environmental pollution. Environmental pollution can cause various health problems such as respiratory issues, skin conditions, and cancer. By curing environmental pollution, we can improve the health of people and the environment.
